c74object.name: fluid.melbands~
c74object.digest: A Perceptually Spread Spectral Contour Descriptor in Real-Time

div.p: Amplitude for a number of equally spread perceptual bands.

c74object.discussion:
Open the Overview Patch
The spread is based on the Mel scale (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mel_scale) which was one of the first attempts to mimic pitch perception scientifically. This implementation allows to select the range and number of bands dynamically.
The process will return a multichannel control steam of size maxNumBands, which will be repeated if no change happens within the algorithm, i.e. when the hopSize is larger than the signal vector size.
fluid.melbands~ is part of the Fluid Decomposition Toolkit of the FluCoMa project. For more explanations, learning material, and discussions on its musicianly uses, visit flucoma.org.

div.p: The maximum number of Mel bands that can be modelled. This sets the number of channels of the output, and therefore cannot be modulated.
How large can the FFT be, by allocating memory at instantiation time. This cannot be modulated.

method.name: reset
method.digest: Return the object to its original state
method.description: Calling reset will change parameter values back to those the object was created with, i.e. any attribute values set in the box will be retained

div.p: FFT settings consist of three numbers representing the window size, hop size and FFT size in samples:
The hop size and fft size can both be set to -1 (and are by default), with slightly different meanings:

ul.li: For the FFT size, -1 = windowSize snapped to the nearest equal / greater power of 2 (e.g. windowSize 1024 => fftSize 1024, but windowsSize 1000 also => fftSize 1024)
FFTSize, if != -1, will set to the next greatest power of two > 4
The maximum manual FFT size is limited to the value of the maxfftsize initialization argument
if FFT size != -1, then window size is clipped at FFT size

div.p: The highest boundary of the highest band of the model, in Hz.
The lower boundary of the lowest band of the model, in Hz.
This flag enables the scaling of the output to preserve the energy of the window. It is on (1) by default.

The number of bands that will be perceptually equally distributed between minFreq and maxFreq. It is limited by the maxNumBands parameter. When the number is smaller than the maximum, the output is zero-padded.
This flag sets the scaling of the output value. It is either linear (0, by default) or in dB (1).
Enable warnings to be issued whenever a parameter value is constrained (e.g. clipped)
